judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen
It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
it is not realistic to do something
You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
a realistic aim or hope is something that it is possible to achieve
I don’t think they have a realistic chance of winning.
realistic pictures or stories show things as they are in real life
a realistic portrayal of life in Victorian Britain
realistic.translation[0].note_box[0].hea: – Meaning 2: a realistic aim or hope is something that it is possible to achieve
realistic.translation[0].note_box[0].sec: We felt we had a realistic chance of beating England.
We do not believe there is any realistic alternative.
There are no realistic expectations of improvement.
A more realistic figure for energy saving would be 20 percent.
Compromise is the only realistic solution.
